tweets.text: To say one more thing.  Piper H described this statement as a "punch to the powerful."  I have a different view.  It reminded me of Yom Kippur.

There are trans and non-binary students, staff, and faculty across campus. If your solidarity doesn't extend outside of your own classroom, it's not going far enough. 
#disruptJMM #JMM2020 @JointMath

Waiting for shitty people to retire and/or die doesn't solve any problems for anyone. They're making new transphobes all the time.
#disruptJMM #JMM2020 @JointMath

I'm so glad for #disruptJMM and to see established mathematicians speaking up

Too often, harassing or inappropriate behavior from male mathematicians is excused as "social awkwardness". Everyone needs to be held to the simple standard of treating their colleagues with dignity https://t.co/8aiZHFWqEz

But like, own your responsibility to do better, and don't put the labor on trans / nb people to tell you how to do better.
#disruptJMM #JMM2020 @JointMath

Resources we should learn about: Trevor Project, OSTEM, PFLAG ...
#disruptJMM #JMM2020 @JointMath

Panel answer about transgender and non-binary student support: "There is power in being out...in a 'What are you going to do about it?!' kind of way." The courage of our community, and particularly our junior colleagues is amazing. #disruptJMM
Here it is. #DisruptJMM https://t.co/pIPCd6Nu9s https://t.co/DdGBGsLBKe
‚Äú[C]arry some of this weight with me, so I can get back to thinking about math." üî•‚ù§Ô∏èüî• #DisruptJMM https://t.co/QDuUh9q1cB
I highly recommend reading this incredible woman‚Äôs statement. She read this at the beginning of her Number Theory talk. #DisruptJMM https://t.co/k2H1KmSWYe
You should just think a lot about this entire slide. #DisruptJMM @JointMath #JMM2020 https://t.co/PdzVZg9qhr

Kelly MacArthur now speaking about the ways she's worked to rehumanize exams in a big calculus course. If we're shifting our pedagogy but not our assessments, there's a weird mismatch that undermines our work. #DisruptJMM #JMM2020 @JointMath

It's wild to me, and it's a real mark of my privilege, that I don't know who the harassers are in my particular research community. (I'm not naive enough to pretend there aren't any.) #DisruptJMM https://t.co/YL3PVBELns

A favorite #JMM2020 photo illustrates the joyfulness of Dr. Ulrica Wilson (@Morehouse math prof) & Dr. Karoline Pershell (Exec Director of @AWMmath). What image do you conjure when you think of what mathematicians look like? Tweet other examples below. #disruptJMM @JointMath https://t.co/qPk97dEhKK
In every class, there is a culture. If you're not being intentional about what you want the culture to be, then you can end up with something you really don't want. #DisruptJMM #JMM2020 @JointMath
My PhD advisor took 1/4 of her time acknowledging native lands and discussing sexual harassment in mathematics. It was everything. #DisruptJMM

Big thanks to aBa Mbirika for a fun and beautiful talk reminding me and us all how fun and beautiful math is. 
#JMM2020 #DisruptJMM @JointMath https://t.co/SwsXWCvDxZ

Of course math has disciplinary worldviews. How could it not? Our collective failure to identify and interrogate our assumptions and worldviews is one of our greatest disciplinary failures. #JMM2020 #disruptJMM @JointMath https://t.co/D1ZiaGHz1i

Panel on supporting trans and non-binary students. "There are gonna be weird moments when someone needs something. Just do it, and help people." 
#disruptJMM #JMM2020 @JointMath https://t.co/4zwkesquu1

@mathprofcarrie I'll be right over!
I need lunch. Where are my #disruptJMM folks?
‚ÄúRemember that data are not neutral.‚Äù from @mathprofcarrie‚Äôs talk on Calling Bull(shit) with R #disruptJMM https://t.co/NK292S2mFl

Advocate for systemic / institutional change if you are in a position to do so, but also, do the stuff that you immediately can.
#disruptJMM #JMM2020 @JointMath

Donating your time or money to LGBTQ+ people or causes is a good way to apologize meaningfully.
#disruptJMM #JMM2020 @JointMath

For my new followers:

I developed a class last summer called Fractals, Algorithms, and Us. I wanted to build an inclusive class where STEM students could learn math while having space to talk/journal about power/justice. #JMM2020 and #DisruptJMM have shown me I‚Äôm not alone üíú

Melody Chan uses her brief time at the podium accepting her award to #DisruptJMM and make the point that it is hard to be a research mathematician in this political climate but that we do have contributions to make.  #JMM2020 https://t.co/cNwQYuFc1b
"I know a lot of mediocre white men in academia. There should thus be allowed to be a lot of mediocre people of color in academia." #JMM2020 #DisruptJMM @JointMath

Educators must be more than allies | Kelly Holstine https://t.co/Xl3acCMIKN via @kellydholstine @YouTube
#ClearTheAir #iteachmath #mtbos #DisruptJMM

Harassment in mathematics is harmful for current and would-be mathematicians and also (though less important than the people harmed), as @WanderingPoint makes clear, directly harmful to mathematics itself #DisruptJMM #JMM2020 https://t.co/kZa7uBSfgK
I love what people are doing to make the Joint Meetings and the mathematical community more inclusive.  We need a lot more.  I hope these efforts grow in future conferences. #DisruptJMM

How can allies best handle making mistakes? Know that you're human and give yourself grace. But also, guilt is a useful motivator to do better. Use negative experiences to change yourself for the better. Don't make the same mistake again and again.
#disruptJMM #JMM2020 @JointMath

@SoledadVillar5 @mathyadriana @diazlopezmath @mathprofcarrie @xl772 @LoboWithACause @WanderingPoint @RachelleDeCoste #DisruptJMM was my call to bring #JEDI issues (justice equity diversity inclusion) to the math talks instead of them only happening in social justice sessions.

Get your work out there by networking, going to conferences (and organizing sessions), being of service to the community, learning to give an undergraduate-accessible talk, going to workshops with a purpose, and accepting offers to go and give a talk for an academic colleague.

Our panelists are:
